title: Funnydruids
author: Funnydruids
created_time: May 23, 2022, 01:02:00 PMLast edit: June 06, 2023, 10:14:20 AM by Funnydruids
content: Hi.I tried to verify my account on Localbitcoins but it dosent work. I tried 1000 times. but it never work, and the support aint helping me. So know I had enough. So if anyone is better then me to verify I can sell the account for 50% of whats in the wallet.Or if anyone can help me I could tip that person 0.001 BTC.Thanks.Picutre of it: https://ibb.co/kBv1Vr2

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: What exactly is the problem and which Tier are you trying to verify? Although you may think you have the correct documents, these are some of the reasons why you do not pass the verification :Quote from: https://localbitcoins.com/guides/verification-guideWhen verifying your ID, make sure to use high resolution and unedited pictures of a valid supported document. The images must be originals, not scanned or pictures of photocopies. Verifying for T1 is an easy and fast process, but some ID verification attempts might fail due to: Date of birth missing from documentExpired documentPoor image qualityUnsupported documentIn addition, someone else who would try to verify your account would very likely find themselves in trouble, because different documents would certainly only make the situation worse. Therefore, I suggest that you read the instructions well and try to verify yourself exactly according to the instructions.

comments.author: Funnydruids
comments.body: Ok thanks. I can close the account to. (But it take two weeks for the BTC to arrive in the wallet I want them to send it, and its not a option)I got no idea about anything. I have been using Paxful before, but this is only trouble.  The documents works, is active.. yes I dont know what to do.and I have not upload my documents, when I try my phone just shut down and it says "Not enough memory, it will close now"

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: What are your limitations? If you can't withdraw but you can trade, then you could sell those BTC for Paypal or for local transfer.When you try to verify your account what error do you get? We should know that to be able to help you.

comments.author: Funnydruids
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on May 23, 2022, 01:31:50 PMWhat are your limitations? If you can't withdraw but you can trade, then you could sell those BTC for Paypal or for local transfer.When you try to verify your account what error do you get? We should know that to be able to help you.I go to verify it. I get a link in my phone as SMS. I open the link.When I gonna take a photo of my ID card it says "Not enough memory" and I get back to the first step.Time after time after time after time.I cant trade or send the bitcoin to another wallet. But I can delete the account (then I must wait two weeks to recive the BTC)

comments.author: Funnydruids
comments.body: Ok. I will try to do it. Thanks.

comments.author: Crypto22265
comments.body: Quote from: Funnydruids on May 23, 2022, 01:33:39 PMQuote from: seoincorporation on May 23, 2022, 01:31:50 PMWhat are your limitations? If you can't withdraw but you can trade, then you could sell those BTC for Paypal or for local transfer.When you try to verify your account what error do you get? We should know that to be able to help you.I go to verify it. I get a link in my phone as SMS. I open the link.When I gonna take a photo of my ID card it says "Not enough memory" and I get back to the first step.Time after time after time after time.I cant trade or send the bitcoin to another wallet. But I can delete the account (then I must wait two weeks to recive the BTC)The error seems to be on your side,most likely from your browser. Have you tried accessing the link in a different browser or maybe on a different phone? You could also try opening the link in desktop version on your mobile browser.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on May 23, 2022, 01:14:44 PMWhat exactly is the problem and which Tier are you trying to verify? Although you may think you have the correct documents, these are some of the reasons why you do not pass the verification :Quote from: https://localbitcoins.com/guides/verification-guideWhen verifying your ID, make sure to use high resolution and unedited pictures of a valid supported document. The images must be originals, not scanned or pictures of photocopies. Verifying for T1 is an easy and fast process, but some ID verification attempts might fail due to: Date of birth missing from documentExpired documentPoor image qualityUnsupported documentIn addition, someone else who would try to verify your account would very likely find themselves in trouble, because different documents would certainly only make the situation worse. Therefore, I suggest that you read the instructions well and try to verify yourself exactly according to the instructions.Not to mention there's no telling how the funds got there in the first place.  Maybe the account was involved in a scam that blew up and now the police are just waiting for whoever is dumb enough to upload their info and take the blame for $150.  Regardless of the situation, verifying your identity with online sites should never be taken lightly and doing so in a situation like this would be hard to view as anything other than fraud in the eyes of the law.  Even if the amount was 50x higher, I still wouldn't recommend anyone go near this.

FBI waiting to catch somebody for 170 Euro.You watch to mutch Hollywood movies.I sended them there from my Paxful account because I wanted to try Localbitcoin.I am a normal guy so calm down Mr Hollywood.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Funnydruids on May 23, 2022, 01:33:39 PMI go to verify it. I get a link in my phone as SMS. I open the link.When I gonna take a photo of my ID card it says "Not enough memory" and I get back to the first step.Time after time after time after time.The problem could be in the storage of your phone, it seems that you do not have enough memory to save a photo of your ID. Try deleting some old images or files you don't need, or change the image quality in the camera settings. Although this may not solve the problem, because some users report similar things, so it may be a specific bug.https://forum.fairphone.com/t/not-enough-memory-to-take-picture-for-no-reason/67685

comments.author: Funnydruids
comments.body: Problem solved. Thanks for all friendly answers and tips. Good forum and great people here.
